item.title: Book report: The Ideal Team Player
item.description: TL;DR The three virtues Humility Hunger Smart Where’s the proof? Compared to Turn the Ship Around! The Goal The story Hiring & promoting Employee Development Trusted Advisors What about performance? Dollar-store psychology Conclusion Improve myself Improve my team Recently I’ve read The Ideal Team Player by Patrick Lencioni following Yoav Alon’s recommendation. I’ve read it on a train: best way to read books. You can’t do anything else, and your fellow passengers think you’re smart.

item.title: E for Engineering: From defense to IT | Better Tech Leadership interview
Book report: Turn the Ship Around! A VP R&D's Summary
item.description: Recently I’ve read Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet following Anton Drukh’s recommendation. This summary is mostly for me and for people I’ll refer it to - so it’s not the most friendly read. But if you don’t have time to read the book, this post can serve as a useful TL;DR for you. I highly recommend you do read it - it’s a great read and a short one, too!
